titleStmt.title: D. S. Hays to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG2270

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
Hopkinsville Kentucky
Nov 7' 1865
His Excellency Thos E Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Dear Sir

Lafayette is a small Village in the South West Corner of our County. Whare they tell me a Notary Public is badly needed and have recommended Thomas J. Fuqua -- he is a gentleman well qualified and hope you will Commission Mr Fuqua and enclose the Commission to me --
I enclose two Dollars the fee -- We prefer you to Powell for United States Senator and hope you will permit your name to go before the Legislature --

your friend & --
D. S. Hays
Christian Co
Notary Public
Thos J Fuqua
apptd
9th Nov/65
